text: It is a world of disappointment: often to the hopes we most cherish, and hopes that do our nature the greatest honour.
name: Charles Dickens

name: Scientific fact

name: Proverb

name: English lullaby

name: Elvis Presley

name: Julius Caesar

text: The deepest parts of the ocean are less explored than the surface of the moon concealing world within a world.

name: Fact about arts

name: Idioms

text: The United States de facto authorizes the practice of extraordinary rendition, which means any prisoner could be transferred to any country for the purposes of interrogation.
name: Fact about politics

name: Beau Taplin

text: The best way to find out if you are dreaming is to read something, because reading never works in dreams.
name: The Stand

text: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.

text: Friends share more DNA than strangers. A study discovered that the DNA between friends is more genetically similar than random pairs of strangers.
name: Scientific fact

text: Practice makes perfect, so just persevere, and you will speak Chinese fluently.
name: Proverb

text: He loved the sea, he loved the rock, but he had no affection for the air. The air to him was an obnoxious adventure.
name: The History of Mr. Polly

text: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
name: Proverb

text: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.

text: Hope is not crazy. It's not naive. It's not stupid. It's brave, and it's fierce, and it's very strong.
name: Wonder Woman

text: Home is where you can be yourself and feel comfortable in your own skin.
name: Shania Twain

text: Capitalism does live by crises and booms, just as a human being lives by inhaling and exhaling.
name: Leon Trotsky

text: The longest time between two twins being born is 87 days.
name: Interesting Fact

text: No advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimeter nearer.
name: George Orwell

text: Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.
name: Forrest Gump

text: Dinosaur fossils have been found on all seven continents. Dinosaurs might have roamed right through your backyard.
name: Scientific fact

text: Fatty fish is excellent for your brain for one simple reason that it contains Omega 3. Around 60% of human brain is fat, and around a half of that is Omega 3 fatty acids, so food rich in Omega 3 is essential for the brain.
name: Fact about food

text: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
name: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: The phrase "when pigs fly" is used to describe something unlikely to happen. It comes from the phrase "pigs fly with their tails forward", used in the 17th century as a reply to overly optimistic statements.
name: idioms

text: Ravens remember faces well and connect them to certain experiences, which is why they are capable of holding a grudge against people who did something wrong to them.
name: Animal fact

name: Idioms

text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
name: Walter Winchell

name: Forrest Gump

text: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more, that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.
name: The Notebook

text: Home is a name, a word, it is a strong one; stronger than a magician ever spoke, or spirit ever answered to, in the strongest conjuration.
name: Charles Dickens

text: Humor brings insight and tolerance. Irony brings a deeper and less friendly understanding.
name: Agnes Repplier

text: Lake Balkhash is one of the largest lakes in Asia. Its western part is fresh water, while its eastern half is saline. This is due to a land separation that doesn’t allow the water to mix properly.
name: Fact about the world

text: Australians are the biggest consumers of meat in the world, eating around 200 pounds (90.72 kg) of meat per person per year.
name: Fact about food

text: I love cats because I enjoy my home; and little by little, they become its visible soul.
name: Jean Cocteau

text: You can't make an omelet without breaking a few eggs.
name: Proverb

text: No matter what anybody tells you, words and ideas can change the world.
name: Dead Poets Society

text: It takes Venus longer to rotate around its own axis than around the Sun, so a day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
name: Fact about space

text: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
name: Robert Frost

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine and shadows will fall behind you.
name: Walt Whitman

text: "Pardon my French" is a phrase used to apologize for swearing.
name: Idioms

text: Rhinos can be extremely aggressive in the wild because they are nearly blind and incapable of telling the difference between a predator and an inanimate object, but in zoos they are reported to be very affectionate with people.
name: Animal fact

name: German law

name: Proverb

text: Focus more on your desire than on your doubt, and the dream will take care of itself.
name: Mark Twain

text: Knowledge becomes evil if the aim be not virtuous.
name: Plato

name: Fact about space

text: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
name: Charles Dickens

text: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink.
name: Proverb

text: Wealth, like happiness, is never attained when sought after directly. It comes as a by-product of providing a useful service.

name: Fact about politics

name: George Bernard Shaw

text: Professional Sleeper, wherein individuals are hired to test the comfort of beds and mattresses.

name: Proverb

text: Pluto is only half as wide as the United States from the West Coast to the East, and its entire surface is smaller than the territory of Russia.

text: Home is where the heart is, and my heart is wherever I am at the moment.
name: Lily Leung

text: People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for.

text: Since excuses were invented, no one is ever in the wrong.
name: Mexican proverb

text: Joan Ginther scored more than $20 million in four scratcher lottery wins.
name: Interesting fact

text: Two things awe me most, the starry sky above me and the moral law within me.
name: Immanuel Kant

text: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.

name: J.K. Rowling

name: Theodore Roosevelt

text: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.

text: An ice cube takes up about 9% more volume than the water used to make it. This explains why liquids expand in containers when they are frozen.

text: A barking dog never bites is what they say about people who would threaten others, but never act upon those threats.

text: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.

name: George Bernard Shaw

text: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.

name: Fact about arts

name: Russian proverb

text: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
name: John Barrymore

name: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

text: Stronger and more lasting memories are created when the brain is influenced by theta waves. These brain waves are associated with relaxation.

text: A sense of humor is part of the art of leadership, of getting along with people, of getting things done.

text: When life gives you lemons, make lemonade.

text: You can't judge a book by its cover.
name: Proverb

text: From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere.
name: Dr. Seuss

name: Fact about flora

name: Fact about space

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
name: Friedrich Nietzsche

name: Historical fact

name: Osho

text: "A barking dog never bites" is what they say about people who would threaten others, but never act upon those threats.
name: Proverb

text: Professional athletes used to perform in vaudeville during the off-season. Before today’s big-league salaries, professional baseball and football players often had a side hustle.
name: Fact about sports

text: When somebody tells you to break a leg, they are actually wishing you luck.
name: Idioms

text: Age appears best in four things: old wood to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust and old authors to read.
name: Francis Bacon

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
name: Steve Jobs

text: Dinosaurs lived on Earth for around 160 million years, which is 64 times longer than people, who have only been around for 2.5 million years.
name: Historical fact

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.
name: Laozi

text: Hope is a renewable option: if you run out of it at the end of the day, you get to start over in the morning.
name: Barbara Kingsolver

text: Nutrition labels provide the information on the ingredients in a particular order. The more of the ingredient is present in the product, the higher up in the list it is placed.
name: Fact about food

text: Everything human is pathetic. The secret source of humor itself is not joy but sorrow. There is no humor in heaven.
name: Mark Twain

text: It is easier to finish a large task by breaking it up into smaller pieces.
name: Life hack

text: A society grows great when old men plant trees in whose shade they shall never sit.
name: Greek proverb

text: The oldest person ever whose age has been independently verified is Jeanne Calment (France) who lived to 122 years and 164 days.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Wealth consists of not having great possessions, but in having few wants.
name: Epictetus

text: Dreams are the touchstones of our character, we should follow them instead of being led astray.
name: Henry David Thoreau

text: Dolphins are capable of forming such strong bonds with people that they sometimes experience intense jealousy.
name: Animal fact

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The surface of the Dead Sea is more than 400 meters below sea level.
name: Interesting fact

text: Affection is the most important thing in life. Without it, life is empty.
name: Pablo Picasso

text: They may take our lives, but they'll never take our freedom!
name: Braveheart

text: Olympic gold medals are actually made of silver. The last fully gold medals given out dates back to 1912
name: Fact about sports

text: If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.
name: Henry David Thoreau

text: Snake island in Brazil is packed with thousands of golden lanceheads, the most poisonous serpents on Earth. The island is so deadly that the government prohibited ever visiting it.
name: Interesting fact

text: There is a kind of magicness about going far away and then coming back all changed.
name: Kate Douglas Wiggin

text: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire and you believe what you imagine.
name: George Bernard Shaw

text: Parallel lines have so much in common. It's a shame they'll never meet.
name: Joke

text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
name: Marcus Aurelius

text: In Singapore, it is illegal to sell or own chewing gum.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.
name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
name: Voltaire

text: Access to the Lascaux caves, famous for paleolithic cave paintings, is severely restricted to preserve the ancient artwork from damage.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.
name: Samuel Butler

text: Some scientists believe that Neptune is not the last planet of the Solar System and that there is the so-called Planet Nine, five to ten times larger than the Earth, that has thus far remained undetected.
name: Fact about space

text: Chill music makes people more generous. A study made listeners play a game, in which they were dictators handing out rations to their citizens. Those who heard the chill songs were far more generous than the others.
name: Fact about music

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
name: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The richest man is not he who has the most, but he who needs the least.
name: The Pursuit of Happyness

text: Jennifer Lawrence, an American actress, has a tattoo that says "H2O" on her hand. It reminds her to drink water.
name: Interesting fact

text: When you see a good move, look for a better one.
name: Emanuel Lasker

text: Those who have knowledge, don't predict. Those who predict, don't have knowledge.
name: Lao Tzu

text: Anne Parrish bought herself the same copy of a book she owned as a child.
name: Interesting fact

text: I could not tread these perilous paths in safety, if I did not keep a saving sense of humor.
name: Horatio Nelson

text: Dream no small dreams for they have no power to move the hearts of men.
name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: During the First World War, the French built a fake Paris to confuse German bombers. It was a huge project with replicas of all the important landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower.
name: Historical fact

text: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
name: Albert Einstein

text: Surma men engage in stick-fighting known as "Donga," a ritual to prove their strength and attract potential brides.
name: Fact about Surma

text: In an effort to prevent obesity in its citizens, Japan created the Metabo Law. This requires people between the ages of 40 to 74 to have an annual waist measurement performed at the doctor.
name: Japanese law

text: It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation that give you happiness.
name: Thomas Jefferson

text: The Maya had their skulls deformed because it was considered beautiful. Moreover, it was common to drill holes in their teeth and insert jewels there.
name: Historical fact

text: A cheerful frame of mind, reinforced by relaxation... is the medicine that puts all ghosts of fear on the run.
name: George Matthew Adams

text: Why don't some adults play hide and seek? Because good luck hiding when everyone you know just wants something from you.
name: Joke

text: Sufficient sleep, exercise, healthy food, friendship, and peace of mind are necessities, not luxuries.
name: Mark Halperin

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
name: Robert Frost

text: There were thirteen participants in the Gunpowder Plot.
name: Historical fact

text: The Universe is expanding at an accelerated speed, which might be due to the fact that the repulsive gravitation of dark energy is overpowering the attractive gravitation of matter.
name: Fact about space

text: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
name: Chinese proverb

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
name: George Bernard Shaw

text: No mind is thoroughly well organized that is deficient in a sense of humor.
name: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: We can ride horses, but not zebras because zebras are unpredictable and aggressive. Zoo workers consider zebras to be one of the most dangerous animals in the zoo.
name: Animal fact

text: Nobody knows who gave Earth its name, but the word itself can be traced back to the Indo-European word for “ground”. All the other planets in our Solar System, except for our planet, were named after the Greek and Roman gods.
name: Fact about the world

text: Fish are the last to know they are in water. They are so surrounded by it that it is impossible for them to see it.
name: Albert Schweitzer

text: Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you.
name: Pericles

text: The Aldabra giant tortoise can weigh more than 500 pounds (220 kg) and can live longer than 250 years.
name: Animal fact

text: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all the darkness.
name: Desmond Tutu

text: Water slide testers check to see if the water slides in resorts, theme parks and hotels are both fun and safe. Imagine how fantastic it would be turning up to work every single day.
name: Fact about jobs

text: Everyone on Earth is at most fiftieth cousin with everyone else. And people that share the same ethnicity and live in the same country are likely to be related within 10 past generations.
name: Interesting fact

text: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: Mere color, unspoiled by meaning, and unallied with definite form, can speak to the soul in a thousand different ways.
name: Oscar Wilde

text: The first picture of a person was made in 1838. It was unintentional because a 10-minute exposure couldn't catch moving people, but it caught a man and a shoeshiner, who remained still on a busy street.
name: Historical fact

text: During 15 years of conquest, Alexander the Great never lost a single battle.
name: Historical fact

text: The luxury of all luxury - to go where you want, when you want - is the most scalable lifestyle imaginable.
name: Tim Ferriss

text: You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because the reality is finally better than your dreams.
name: Dr. Seuss

text: The first mentions of Oxford University date back to the year of 1096
name: Historical fact

text: Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.
name: Ibn Battuta

text: Hippos can't swim well and the only reason they spend the majority of their lives in water is to protect their very sensitive skin.
name: Animal fact

text: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
name: Confucius

text: Marcel Proust’s Remembrance of Things Past is the longest book in the world at 9,609,000 characters. The book tells the story of the narrator’s experiences growing up.
name: Fact about arts

text: The Moon is drifting away from the Earth little by little - by about 1.5 inches (3.8 cm) a year.
name: Fact about space

text: Love is the emblem of eternity; it confounds all notion of time; effaces all memory of a beginning, all fear of an end.
name: Madame de Staël

text: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
name: Ayn Rand

text: Golf ball dimples are needed to increase its flight range. The air flowing around the bumpy ball reduces the vacuum wake created by the velocity.
name: Fact about sports

text: In the future, love will transcend time and space, creating connections beyond the boundaries of earth and stars.
name: Dr. Jane Smith

text: Guinea pigs can purr like cats when they're happy.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Laughter is, after speech, the chief thing that holds society together.
name: Max Eastman

text: In 1518, people of Strasbourg contracted a strange disease and started dancing nonstop for weeks. Reportedly, as many as 400 people danced until falling unconscious from exhaustion.
name: Historical fact

text: Loud music causes you to drink more in less time. A French study found that loud music in a bar setting leads to increased drinking within a shorter amount of time.
name: Fact about music

text: And when you're needing your space to do some navigating, I'll be here patiently waiting to see what you find.
name: Jason Mraz

text: Boost your productivity by decluttering your workspace and materialize your goals by making a vision board.
name: Life hack

text: If he has a conscience he will suffer for his mistake. That will be his punishment - as well as the prison.
name: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: The founder of the iconic electric guitar and bass brand and Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee Leo Fender never learned to play either instrument.
name: Fact about music

text: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
name: C.S. Lewis

text: George Washington's wooden teeth are just a popular myth.
name: Historical fact

text: The world’s longest-lasting kiss took over fifty-eight hours. It took place to mark the sharing of love on Valentine’s Day in 2013
name: World record

text: The Vikings discovered America nearly five hundred years prior to Columbus. Leif Eriksson of Greenland was the first European to land on the Island of Newfoundland.
name: Historical fact

text: There is a giant gas cloud in the constellation of Aquila with enough alcohol to provide everyone on Earth with 300,000 pints of beer a day for one billion years.
name: Fact about space

text: In Milan, Italy, it is a legal requirement to smile at all times, except during funerals or hospital visits.
name: Interesting Fact

text: For many cultures, children are told to keep their baby teeth under their pillow and the Tooth Fairy will give them money. But Greek children are told to toss their tooth onto their roofs.
name: Greek custom

text: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's biggest single structure made by living organisms.
name: Guinness World Records

text: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest structure on Earth.
name: Interesting fact

text: The Jackson 5's debut album was released before Michael Jackson's voice broke, leading many to believe it was a girl singing.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Love is friendship that has caught fire, calmness that quiets inner chaos, confidence for uncertain hours.
name: Ann Landers

text: We promise according to our hopes and perform according to our fears.
name: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Aiko Nakagawa ran 105 marathons in a single year, setting a remarkable world record.
name: Interesting Fact

text: Sheep Counting is an official sport in Australia. About 400 sheep make a mad dash past ten competitors, who will try to count them. Whoever makes the most accurate estimate is the winner.
name: Fact about sports

text: Winners never quit and quitters never win. Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
name: Heywood Broun

text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or objects.
name: Albert Einstein

text: When your little one is exploring the world on all fours, why not have them do a little cleaning? The Baby Mop is a onesie with soft mop heads for scrubbing action. Your floors will shine.
name: Fact about inventions

text: All the knowledge I possess everyone else can acquire, but my heart is all my own.
name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Families with two daughters are the happiest. Researchers concluded that two girls are unlikely to fight and rarely annoy their parents. But oddly enough, families with four girls were found to be the unhappiest.
name: Interesting fact

text: The ache for home lives in all of us, the safe place where we can go as we are and not be questioned.
name: Maya Angelou

text: The Oscars given out in World War II were made from wood because metal was so scarce.
name: Interesting fact

text: Learn the craft of knowing how to open your heart and to turn on your creativity. There's a light inside of you.
name: Judith Jamison

text: Relaxing your back can help clear mental clutter and improve spinal flexibility.
name: Relax life hack

text: I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through.
name: Jules Verne

text: Most poor people do not live in poor countries. Over 70% of them actually live in middle-income countries.
name: Fact about economics

text: With no skill at all, he was like a fifth wheel at the company.
name: Idiom

text: A personal star on the Walk of Fame is not really an award for being a successful performer. You have to pay $30,000 in order to have it installed there.
name: Fact about Hollywood

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
name: Epictetus

text: Climate change is causing flowers to change color.
name: Fact about the world

text: The footsteps left on the surface of the Moon will remain there for millions of years, because the Moon has no atmosphere and therefore no wind.
name: Fact about space

text: Upon his wife's death, Herod the Great kept her body, preserved in honey, for 7 years.
name: Historical fact

text: Cats know how to obtain food without labor, shelter without confinement, and love without penalties.
name: W.L. George

text: Wealth is not about having a lot of money; it's about having a lot of options.
name: Chris Rock

text: Surtsey in Iceland is one of the world’s youngest islands. No visitors are allowed to visit this spot, because human intrusion will upset the ecological sequence that is currently ongoing on the island.
name: Interesting fact

text: People who are currently alive represent about seven percent of the total number of people who have ever lived.
name: Fact about the world

text: Trust yourself. Think for yourself. Act for yourself. Speak for yourself. Be yourself. Imitation is suicide.
name: Marva Collins

text: "Jingle Bells" was originally a thanksgiving song. Written by James Lord Pierpont and published in 1857, it was meant to be sung during Thanksgiving.
name: Fact about music

text: Travel is more than the seeing of sights; it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.
name: Miriam Beard

text: Although cinnamon is not particularly sweet by itself, it enhances the sweetness of all the other ingredients.
name: Fact about food

text: You are not being honest if you burn your tongue and don't tell everyone else that the soup is hot.
name: Serbian proverb

text: The fastest gust of wind ever recorded on Earth was 253 miles per hour. In 1996, a tropical cyclone named Olivia hit off the coast of Barrow Island, Australia.
name: Fact about the world

text: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
name: John F. Kennedy

text: Pluto is not the only dwarf planet in the solar system, we also have Ceres, Makemake, Haumea and Eris.
name: Fact about space

text: Giant sloths are actually very good swimmers and are capable of holding their breath for 40 minutes - longer than seals and dolphins.
name: Animal fact

text: In just one teaspoon of soil, there are more microorganisms than people on the planet.
name: Scientific fact

text: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
name: Woodrow Wilson

text: The world’s longest concert by multiple artists lasted for 453 hours, 54 minutes, and 40 seconds. It was part of Canada’s celebration of their country’s 150th anniversary in 2017
name: Fact about music

text: A good traveller is one who knows how to travel with the mind.
name: Michael Johnson

text: Although we imagine the Moon to be a barren land, it actually has ice on its poles, much like the Earth, and water in the interior.
name: Fact about space

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
name: Aristotle

text: Pirates never used treasure maps, it's just a popular literary and movie myth.
name: Historical fact

text: There is a 150-year-old oak tree at the center of a soccer field in Estonia. The locals who play football on the pitch have become used to it and know how to use the tree to complete passes.
name: Fact about sports

text: The youngest person to climb Mount Everest is Jordan Romero. The American teen was 13 years old when he reached the summit, accompanied by his father.
name: World record

text: Alaska pays each resident a guaranteed income - dividends out of oil revenues.
name: Fact about economics

text: Financial success is not about the size of your paycheck. It's about your ability to create assets that generate passive income.
name: Robert Kiyosaki

text: Some of our greatest historical and artistic treasures we place with curators in museums; others we take for walks.
name: Roger A. Caras

text: The first ebook in the world is The Declaration of Independence, released in 1971. Michael Stern Hart transcribed it and made it available for everyone for free, starting the famous Project Gutenberg.
name: Fact about books

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted, because humor is simply the defiance of despair.
name: Charlie Chaplin

text: Transform clutter into character by curating collections, using vertical spaces, and making storage an aesthetic highlight.
name: Life Hack

text: The Great Dictator, one of the most famous Charlie Chaplin's movies, was produced entirely with Chaplin's own money. Hollywood was too afraid to pick the wrong side and lose the money at the time.
name: Fact about movies

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
name: William James

text: Neil Armstrong does have a place on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, but it's not a star. He has a moon instead.
name: Fact about Hollywood

text: Touching a toad won't give you warts. This rumor probably originated from the fact that toads themselves have wart-like bumps on their skin, but they don't secrete anything that can cause warts.
name: Popular myth

text: The skinniest waist ever was awarded to Cathie Jung in 1999. An American had a 15-inch (38-cm) waist. The woman had never had surgery to define it. She had been wearing a corset for 16 years.
name: World record

text: Lotus was considered a symbol of resurrection in Ancient Egypt, because the flower can bloom in flooded areas, but it can also survive for years during droughts and bloom again when it is watered.
name: Fact about flora

text: Tomatoes have more genes than humans. This vegetable contains 31,760 genes – that is 7,000 more genes than a human.
name: Scientific fact

text: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
name: Bruce Lee

text: As of 2022, Finland is considered to be the best country to live in, with the “Social Progress Index” (human rights + wellbeing + opportunities for self-fulfillment) reaching as high as 90.09
name: Fact about economics

text: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
name: Robert A Heinlein

text: In France, it's customary to greet people with a cheek kiss, known as 'la bise,' which varies in number depending on the region.
name: French Tradition

text: Mars is the only planet known to mankind that is populated by robots, which were sent there from the Earth.
name: Fact about space

text: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family. Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
name: Jane Howard

text: Among all the animals on Earth, only humans are able to enjoy spicy food.
name: Interesting fact

text: Most orchids don’t produce nectar, so in order to lure pollinators, their flowers visually resemble a female wasp and produce a scent that attracts male wasps. The wasps pollinate the plant as they try to mate with it.
name: Fact about flora

text: Travel isn't always pretty. It isn't always comfortable. Sometimes it hurts, it even breaks your heart. But that's okay.
name: Anthony Bourdain

text: Japan has one of the highest densities of vending machines in the world, with one for every 40 people in the country.
name: Fact about economics

text: In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.
name: Albert Camus

text: The Leaning Tower of Pisa was constructed like this from the very beginning.
name: Historical fact

text: Love conquers all things, so we too shall yield to love.
name: Publius Vergilius Maro

text: Love is a game that two can play and both can win.
name: Eva Gabor

text: In Switzerland, it is illegal to flush the toilet after 10 pm in an apartment building.
name: Interesting Fact

text: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight; it's the size of the fight in the dog.
name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: Despite his extensive work as a theoretical physicist and cosmologist, Stephen Hawking never received any Nobel Prizes.
name: Scientific fact

text: The founding king of Saudi Arabia was sometimes called the "Leopard of the Desert"
name: Historical fact

text: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it, we go nowhere.
name: Carl Sagan

text: The ocean is divided into distinct zones, including the sunlight zone, twilight zone, and midnight zone.
name: Interesting Fact

text: It’s much healthier to keep potatoes skin instead of peeling it, because it’s very rich in nutrients, including potassium, vitamin B3, iron, magnesium, phosphorous, calcium, copper, and zinc.
name: Fact about flora

text: The hardest thing in the world to understand is the income tax.
name: Albert Einstein

text: In love there is always one who kisses and one who offers the cheek.
name: French proverb

text: The Himba use otjize paste, a mixture of butterfat and ochre pigment, to protect their skin from the harsh desert climate.
name: Fact about the Himba

text: The Dani people engage in a tradition called "pig festival," where pigs are sacrificed to ensure good fortune.
name: Fact about Dani

text: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
name: Rene Descartes

text: In Svalbard, Norway, there are more polar bears than humans. It's not safe to leave town without a rifle.
name: Interesting Fact

text: It is illegal to eat ice cream on Bank street in Ottawa on Sunday. Any other day is good, just keep it indoors on Sunday.
name: Canadian law

text: In Ancient Greece, men usually wore tunics and would laugh at men who put on trousers, since they were considered effeminate.
name: Historical fact

text: Unlike in math, in real life two wrongs don't make a right.
name: English proverb

text: The best thing about the future is that it comes one day at a time.
name: Abraham Lincoln

text: In Iraq, booksellers just leave books outside at night unattended because "the reader does not steal and the thief does not read"
name: Fact about books

text: Not counting the North and South Poles, the Atacama Desert is the driest place on Earth. Some of its parts have not seen a drop of rain in over 500 years.
name: Fact about the world

text: The sea is not a destination but a transformation.
name: Sylvia Earle

text: You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star.
name: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Poison dart frogs are only poisonous because they eat poisonous ants and insects. In zoos, where their diet is controlled, they do not produce any poison.
name: Animal fact

text: Everyone on Earth is at most fiftieth cousins with everyone else. And people that share the same ethnicity and live in the same country are likely to be related within 10 past generations.
name: Interesting fact

text: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
name: Wayne W. Dyer

text: The Morells, a unique family, have adopted over 70 children from around the world.
name: Interesting Fact

text: After being told he couldn't keep dogs on campus, Lord Byron brought a bear as his pet. It was his protest against the college rules.
name: Historical fact

text: Anthony Hopkins happened upon a signed copy of the book he was searching for in a train station.
name: Interesting fact

text: Huli Wigmen create elaborate wigs from their own hair and wear them as a symbol of status and identity.
name: Fact about Huli Wigmen

text: Truth is the ultimate power. When the truth comes around, all the lies have to run and hide.
name: Ice Cube

text: Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.
name: Syrus

text: If you want people to like you, ask questions about them rather than talking about yourself.
name: Life hack

text: Cleopatra was Greek, not Egyptian, as many people tend to believe.
name: Historical fact

text: If you want a high living standard, you have to settle for a low quality of life.
name: Unknown author

text: Two unrelated men, both named Mr. Dooly, born, married, and died on the same days in the same city.
name: Interesting fact

text: “To Have and Have Not” is the only instance when a Nobel prize-winning author was adapted for the screen by another Nobel-winning author. They were Ernest Hemingway and William Faulkner.
name: Interesting fact

text: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you; they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
name: Bernice Johnson Reagon

text: The ocean is a vast wilderness where animals roam freely, and we have a responsibility to protect their home.
name: Paul Walker

text: Capoeira was created by enslaved Africans in Brazil. African slaves were prohibited from practicing martial arts. Therefore, they developed a mix of dancing and fighting.
name: Fact about arts

text: Five small snacks throughout the day can satiate hunger better than one big meal.
name: Life hack

text: Wimbledon tennis balls are kept at twenty degrees Celsius. The temperature of a tennis ball affects how it bounces.
name: Fact about sports

text: We see many who are struggling against adversity who are happy, and more although abounding in wealth, who are wretched.
name: Tacitus

text: Rats are able to experience joy and laugh. They express their good humor by emitting a high-pitched chirping noise.
name: Animal fact

text: It is impossible to wake up someone who's just pretending to be asleep.
name: Filipino proverb

text: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they have got a second.
name: William James

text: The Palace Theatre of London had two seats permanently bolted open for the theater ghosts to sit in, so the public never used them. That was until Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, which sold so well these two seats had to come back.
name: Fact about theaters

text: A wish is a hope or desire for something. May all your wishes come true.
name: Catherine Pulsifer

text: The combined weight of all Earth's ants matches that of all humans.
name: Interesting fact

text: In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
name: Confucius

text: Japanese scientists designed a robotic girlfriend’s hand. A humanlike motorized hand is made for people who just want a hand to hold. It is able to heat up and even sweat.
name: Fact about inventions

text: Art is not what you see, but what you make other people see.
name: Edgar Degas

text: Before the invention of dentures, doctors used teeth of dead soldiers as prosthetics.
name: Historical fact

text: Home, the spot of earth supremely blest, a dearer and sweeter spot than all the rest.
name: Robert Montgomery

text: What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
name: William Shakespeare

text: About 69% of the world's freshwater is encased in ice caps, glaciers, and permanent snow.
name: Interesting fact

text: Knowledge is power, information is liberating, education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.
name: Kofi Annan

text: Smart people learn from everything and everyone; average people, from their experiences. The stupid already have all the answers.
name: Socrates

text: F. Scott Fitzgerald was the first writer to use the term “T-shirt”. According to the Oxford English Dictionary, it appeared in This Side of Paradise in 1920
name: Fact about arts

text: Elvis Presley is still the best-selling solo artist in the world, with more than one billion sales worldwide.
name: Fact about music

text: Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you.
name: Mary Lou Retton

text: Spartans didn't work because the country was so rich it awarded lands and slaves to their citizens upon reaching adulthood.
name: Historical fact

text: The wise traveler leaves his heart at home.
name: African proverb

text: The boy who coxed the winning pair in the rowing events at the 1900 Olympics is believed to be only 7 years old.
name: Fact about sports

text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
name: Jordan Belfort

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
name: Oscar Wilde

text: Ziona Chana from India is known as the head of the largest family in the world. He had 39 wives, 94 children, 14 daughters in-law, and 33 grandchildren - 180 family members in total.
name: Interesting fact

text: Just be yourself. Let people see the real, imperfect, flawed, quirky, weird, beautiful, magical person that you are.
name: Mandy Hale

text: Glaciers and ice sheets hold about sixty-nine percent of all freshwater in the world.
name: Fact about the world

text: Two Dennis the Menace characters emerged in different countries during the same year.
name: Interesting fact

text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
name: Christian D. Larson

text: You may go where you want, but you cannot escape yourself.
name: Norwegian proverb

text: Humans have genes from other species. Our genome consists of as many as 145 genes that have jumped from bacteria, fungi, and viruses.
name: Scientific fact

text: Though a good deal is too strange to be believed, nothing is too strange to have happened.
name: Thomas Hardy

text: A home is a kingdom of its own in the midst of the world, a stronghold amid life’s storms and stresses.
name: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

text: If stored in a closed jar, honey does not have a shelf life and will never go bad. Honey is very low in moisture and very acidic, so bacteria cannot survive in it.
name: Fact about food

text: Please don't ask me what the score is. I'm not even sure what the game is.
name: Ashleigh Brilliant

text: Humpback whales are known to protect animals hunted by orcas. This is supposedly connected to the fact that orcas hunt humpback calves, so the adult whales are compelled to protect any animal in the range of orcas' hunting calls.
name: Animal fact

text: A couple found wedding vows in a bottle written on the same day they wed.
name: Interesting fact

text: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
name: Socrates

text: Fresh eggs always sink to the bottom of a glass filled with water, while the bad ones float.
name: Fact about food

text: Who offends writes on sand; who is offended, on marble.
name: Italian proverb

text: Scientists believe that there is an enormous black hole in the center of nearly every large galaxy, including the Milky Way.
name: Fact about space

text: Treat a work of art like a prince: let it speak to you first.
name: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
name: William Wordsworth

text: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'You too? I thought I was the only one'
name: C.S. Lewis

text: The sensation you get after eating a chili pepper is not a physical reaction. The pepper doesn't burn your tongue, but it does contain a chemical that tricks your pain receptors into thinking you are consuming something extremely hot.
name: Fact about food

text: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people at hand.
name: Kahlil Gibran

text: Face feelers are also known as “sensory scientists”. In this job you’d be using your hands to feel the difference in product testers’ skin both before and after they’ve used lotions and creams.
name: Fact about jobs

text: The human body can go longer without food than without sleep (1-2 months vs. only around 10 days)
name: Interesting fact

text: Fort Knox is home to the bigger half of the US gold reserves, and is often referred to as the world’s most heavily guarded place. To gain access, one needs to know several combinations, whereas each staff member knows just one of them.
name: Interesting fact

text: There was this myth in Ancient Greece: "redheads will become vampires after death"
name: Historical fact

text: Consider your origins: you were not made to live as brutes, but to follow virtue and knowledge.
name: Dante Alighieri

text: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
name: Charlotte Brontë

text: Rogue planets do not belong to any planetary system.
name: Fact about space

text: The temperature of the Universe (the cosmic microwave background) is surprisingly uniform everywhere, which is very strange since some parts of space should never have come into contact.
name: Fact about space

text: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people they don't like.
name: Will Rogers

text: The Borgia family in Renaissance Italy was infamous for hosting lavish parties where guests were unknowingly poisoned.
name: Interesting Fact

text: I dream of painting and then I paint my dream.
name: Vincent Van Gogh

text: The Japanese created a bitescan - a special device that measures your chewing strokes. It helps to analyze your eating habits, from how much you eat to how quickly.
name: Fact about inventions

text: The urban window baby cage was used in the 1930s to give infants plenty of fresh air. However, the health benefits may have been nullified by the obvious risk of dangling a baby high above a city street.
name: Fact about inventions
